Reviews.Title: Nice phone, but VERY limited memory for storing apps - microSD use doesnt help
Reviews.Author: phoneman
Reviews.Content: This phone has lovely features worthy of a competitor to samsung etc.4G/3G data is fast on Tmobile where they have 1900Mhz coverage, but WONT work at 4G/3G where Tmobile operate only at 1700Mhz. Best to check Tmobile's 4G/3G coverage map before buying this phone, otherwise you'll get slow 2G speeds only at 1700Mhz-only areas (this phone doesnt work at 1700Mhz, hence the 2G speeds). Works well on at&T;, and Lyca mobile (uses Tmobile for 2g/3g/4g coverage).Battery life is very good, around 12 hours with calls and data use during the day.The dual sim functionality works well, with a blue-green color scheme for indicating which carrier is being used.Wifi is OK, Bluetooth OK. Processing speed OK.You CANT upgrade the factory installed version of android (4,1) to any of the later android versions.Screen is large and bright, the back camera OK although pictures are somewhat grainy and pixelated when using the flash in indoor use.Altho the phone comes with a basic rubber-type protector, its almost impossible to get a case for this phone. Only one supplier in the US seems to sell spare batteries.THE BIG FLAW:Sadly, despite these wonderful features, the phone has a MAJOR flaw that is not revealed in the specs. Although the specs say 2GB of storage, actually after the android operating system etc is installed, you ONLY have 512MB of storage to load apps AND data for apps that cant use a micro SD card. That is, some apps like Gmail need to be in the root of the phone and cant be stored (app itself and its data) on a micro SD card. You thus can only add a few apps to this phone in total. Gmail stops working if the mailbox gets too full as there is no space to download mail.  While some apps can be stored on the micro SD card, you'll only know that this alternate storage is possible when you try downloading that app to the phone: it either stores on the micro SD card or not. If the internal memory is full, you'll have to delete other apps or not install it at all.Skype doesnt work at all, and doesnt even install as there is an error message.In other words, you'll never know whether you can install ALL your favorite apps on the phone, as the limited 512MB internal app storage memory halts the ability and the micro SD storage option isnt certain.The more expense Blu phones like the Life One have more internal app storage, so if you need apps, best to forgo buying this phone and spend extra on the Life One.Blu support in Florida is very good. They respond to email quickly and are very helpful over the phone.

Reviews.Title: Blu Studio 5.0
Reviews.Author: Dawn
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my son, as he liked the huge screen of the Note 2. Well my bank account said, no way to the price of a note 2 without contract. I purchased theBlu Studio 5.0 for him, popped in a T-mobile 30.00 a month prepaid sim, and WOW. This phone does everything you need it to. It does not have an S pen of course. The 3G on it is fast, the wifi works great for all his games, the play store has all the android apps you could ever want or need. It is super light weight, that is what made me skeptical to start with, as I believed that it may have been a sub par phone. Not at all. The camera took great pics and it has a front facing camera for "selfies".The battery seems to hold a long charge, I know this because my son plays lots of games from the app store on it. He charges at night and ready to go after school (after responsibilities and homework of course)until bedtime...BTW my son is only 11 years old.All in all we have had the phone for about 3 months now and no issues at all. I am please with the phone and its performance.ONLY CON!!!NO CASES MADE FOR THIS PHONE!! Come on Blu!!! It does come with a thin rubber back case, but this is only to protect the back from scratches when its put down or slid across a surface. I purchased a Note 2 screen protector for him and cut it to fit as the glass is NOT the gorilla glass as on most newer model smartphones.For the price, you CAN NOT GO WRONG with this one if you like a huge screen.

Reviews.Title: Phone is awesome after rooting.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Seriously, this phone was awesome before I rooted it but it's even better now because it was rooted. The internal memory was my only issue and now it's not. I love my blu studio 5.0 LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: big love
Reviews.Author: infideljon
Reviews.Content: I love my new phone so far. at first I did not, but after my daughters husband made the 4G work I love it. the picture is real clear the screen is sensitive so touch is not a dragging across screen. my Straight talk service was a snap to install and as long as you follow the directions you should find no issue. does not come with a micro sim so you will want one of those too. sound out of unit is not good but when hooked to my car stereo it is a great sound. came with a gummy type case and a screen protector.pros1. cost was great2. works seamlessly with straight talk.3. case and screen protector were nice4. easy to setup and operatecons1. it is big so do not get for a small hand2. not many accessories all in all it is a great phone and will be buying more and recommending them to everyone I see.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the money!!!
Reviews.Author: Harry L. Wyche
Reviews.Content: Well I bought 2 of these.  One for my wife and one for me.  It beats the 500 or 600 dollar price.  Well I went to Metro PCS and the sales associate said I don't think they will work.  I said oh yes they will.  The sales associate then installed the card and booted it up.  It worked so well that she was surprised and said her manager said it would not work.  It worked great and still does.  So guess what the sales associate at MPCS told me she is getting one.  Yes the instruction booklet needs improving but you can get demos and the like on you tube from other owners.  I think the very young people want to pay 500 or 600 for status, but I can do everything on this.  And the sales associate said it even looks like the more expensive phones.  It feels good to the touch also.  Some might say well if it breaks in a year or something.  Well for the price I can buy another without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Content: This is a good phone for the price. Alot of people complained about the speaker, well its not that bad. Im able to hear people and music, so I can deal with it. Theres deffinatly more pros then cons. Such as this phone can take screenshots, has a flash, and a front camera. I used to have an android fusion 2 and that had none of these features. However, the only down side like other people have said; I can't find a case for it. Its a shame because I dont want to end up breaking it. It does come with a black silicone case, but Im an 18 year old girl, and picky. But Ive had it for about two weeks now, and overall a good phone.

Reviews.Title: 503 MB of phone internal storage!
Reviews.Author: Mark Soto
Reviews.Content: There is only 503 megabytes of internal storage for apps app data and media content! sd card size does not matter by the 5th app you download you will get the non stop phone storage is running low warning and wont be able to install most apps without deleting things.Down below it claims there is 2GB of phone storage and none of it is used. Its simply a lie this phone is cheap for a reason and it had so much potential.I think I deserve a full refund and extra credit towards a phone that has practical usable storage space such as 8,16, or 32 GB. I like the company because of their price range and it works fine except that one huge flaw!Please this is my first review tell me how I can go about getting a phone for similar price with REAL storage! or contact the company.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone but Tech Support is non existent
Reviews.Author: James D. Spann
Reviews.Content: My HTC One X bit the dust and I needed an affordable replacement.PROSThis phone delivers all the functionality and Android OS user experience I need. Very happy with the design and engineering of the phone.CONSThe user manual is flimsy and really doesn't come near showing you how to full set up and use the phone. Further, the folks at BLU Products do not want to provide tech support. All they offer is an e-mail address. I sent an inquiry one week ago and have not yet received a response. This means you need to buy the phone from a reseller that is committed to tech support.

I'm not saying that it sucks now because it doesn't. It's still a great phone but the storage runs out quickly. For some reason it won't download pictures sent through text messages. I've tried finding ways to receive picture messages but it just wont work. Maybe it's because my phone isn't on a data plan...Generally it's an awesome phone & I love it! :)The only problems I have with it is that the storage runs out fast, Netflix wont download and I can't receive picture messages. :/

Reviews.Title: BLU Studio 5.0 D530 Unlocked GSM Phone with Android 4.0 OS, Dual SIM

My only issue with the device is there are not any accessories for these phones, but the supplier was efficient in providing us this great phone at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Cool

You do have to buy an SD card, but installation is easy. I use net10 with the phone. It works very well. I am very happy with this phone.

Reviews.Title: BLU 5.0
Reviews.Author: luvamazon
Reviews.Content: I just got my phone today & it seems to be made of good quality, speaker is okay when listening to music but it's a little low when i watch netflix or hulu. I love the size of it. mines looks a little different from the pic because it doesn't have the BLU logo on the front. Hopefully I'll be able to get 3g on it (ill update later), text & talk works fine haven't been able to get pic msg yet (ill update later). I haven't noticed any lag and Ive downloaded all my favorite apps/games. I also have a 32gb micro sd  card installed.Update; 3g & pic msg works great. I'm using mines with Straight talk so I had to change the APN settings.Update 9/13/13: Netflix doesnt work. BLU say they are working on a patch to fix it or a update to fix it.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the price!!!
Reviews.Author: M.Jennings
Reviews.Content: In a world surrounded by Samsung Galaxys and Iphones, I wanted to go a little different route and be reasonabe at it. Fortunately, I found it in the Blu Studio 5.0 D530. With it's sleek design, it excellently rivals the popular overly-expensive counterparts in terms of style and functionality. The color on the screen is vibrant, the response to touch is wonderful. People are constantly asking me what kind of phone it is and are immediately interested. For what I use a phone for, it meets every expectation and I am very satisfied. Although being satisfied, there are a few drawbacks to the phone overall, but these are minor disappointments when considering the price point as being a little over $120.00 and with no contract. The first con is the 512mb RAM that is easily exhausted by downloading a number of apps. These apps can be stored on external storage media (micro SD), but occasionally, their operation must be halted in order for the phone to carry out normal text and email reception operations and can't be resumed until enough apps are stopped to make room for usable RAM. Secondly, with my experience, Having to configure the phone for data outside of a WiFi environment was somewhat of a cerebral task. I've been able to do this but am still not able to receive mms transmission. The external speaker could be a tad bit louder, but I can live with it easily! These are the only disappointments worth mentioning concerning this phone. In light of all that it is, the pros easily prevail against the cons. I'm seriously considering giving my wife this one and going with a bigger and better - You guessed it ---BLU!!!!!

Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for the phone before I bought it... I've been able to download every app that I've had on my previous phone and more with no problems so far...So glad I purchased this phone.....

Reviews.Content: excelent phone, up 3g movistar venezuela and movilnet, it's a phablet, and comes in spanish and other laguages, beautifull so fast

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone!!!

Reviews.Content: Everyone should try this phone.  This is a mini computer. I call it wonders of Android. Another fascinating thing is that it came right on time (2 day shipping) and also with a screen protector and case. I just love the phone!

Reviews.Title: NIce Smart Phone for the money
Reviews.Author: Cookie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my daughter as a Christmas gift.  She absolutely loves it.  It is very light weight.  She hates the internal memory storage..too small.  I bought her an external memory card last night.  Without it, her phone is becoming very slow and she didn't want to delete any of her pictures for very good reasons.  She is experiencing an issue with transferring her internal memory to her mciro SD card.  However, she has been able to tell a difference in the performance getting better once she inserted it.  If you have any suggestions on how to achieve this, please let me know.  It takes fairly nice pictures.  The flash is only ok, not excellent.  All in all, you still can get some decent pictures.  Also, it looks nice and expensive and it performs all the great tasks that she needs it to.

Reviews.Title: very useful
Reviews.Author: Leonard Granston
Reviews.Content: Performing better than expected, would recommend it to anyone. Wifi works great, and the speed is good too. Not disappointed..

Reviews.Title: BLU Studio 5.0 D530 Unlocked GSM Phone
Reviews.Author: Bernard Forson
Reviews.Content: This phone was a gift to a friend in overseas who appreciate and love it so much. It performs just like those old brand names.I will recommend to anyone who likes wide screen phones should buy BLU Studio 5.0 D530 because it works perfect in any country.b

Reviews.Title: comfortable
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Kleine
Reviews.Content: Ease of use. Comfortable in my hand without being too big nice big screen without being bulky fun fun fun

Reviews.Title: Bad Customer Service
Reviews.Author: D. Porter
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my wife, it worked all of three days.  When I contacted the company that sold me the phone they had my wife send the phone back. After they received the phone she was told that she would get a replacement in two days.  Then she received a call back from the same person at the company now telling her they weren't going to send her a new phone.  She told my wife that the phone now had pen marks on the back and it wasn't in the original box.  Prior to sending the phone back they were told we no longer had the original box and the phone was in excellent condition when sent back.  Just be careful when ordering anything from this company, just prey it works and you don't have to send it back.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable phone for the price :)
Reviews.Author: Steve Mountfort
Reviews.Content: Everything about the phone I love.  Great display, very fast, holds a charge for 2 to 3 days, at least for me, and I have had absolutely no problems with the phone yet after 3 weeks.

Reviews.Title: poor battery and storage
Reviews.Author: anthony curtiss
Reviews.Content: the battery life of this phone is horrible. I have to charge it twice a day and it takes over three hours to fully charge. the internal storage is also horrible ive had a low storage icon in my notification bar since the first day I got the phone. too much extra crap from the manufacturer already on the phone. I use maybe 25% of the preinstalled apps and cant get rid of them nor can I download more than three extra apps using the internal memory. very disappointed in this product

Reviews.Title: If you like apps, don't buy this phone.  Period.
Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: No quibbling or politics.  Yes this is a pretty phone.  Camera is decent and it is large like the other more expensive brands. That is where the similarity dies.This phone is an under-capable phone because it does not possess the internal storage needed to install enough apps to justify the size and specs for the rest of the phone.  It is so huge, and has the dual core memory, but a teeny internal storage issue.  After FB, email, and Pandora the phone is acting lethargic and the email stops working because it mismanages App storage.So if you plan on never installing another app, or using the phone to check email, go ahead and give it a shot.But, if you  plan on a couple apps (games, forget it, no internal memory space for that), look elsewhere.  This phone allows for a max of 500MB of internal storage (apps, not pics).  The OS takes about 350MB, so once you install a few other apps, you are within the "Warning Range" at which apps stop functioning to preserve phone function.PS - there is apparently a way to root the phone and get it to use the whole 2GB of space which would fix the issue.  If anyone has detailed procedures for this, I would volunteer to try it out and report back.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because i was sick of the iphone 4 going slow so i found this phone on amazon and wanted to give it a try. I looked at the reviews before buying it because i have straight talk and wanted to make sure it worked for it and it does, i had to change a few things in the mobile networking but other than that its a great phone thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: it is ok

Reviews.Content: ProIs fast like others very commercial brandsGood camera resolutionlightConsBattery life is around 7 hours is between the average and over that very expensive commercial brandNo enough memory it should have more than 1GB because some programs install at the internal memory and not at the SD cardThe copy and paste of the any text can be improved

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for the Money!!!
Reviews.Author: Carlos Escobar
Reviews.Content: I bought two phones for my wife and my daughter in order to avoid permanency clauses with the phone company.  At first, they had reticence about the phones, but once they use it, they were delighted to see how easy was to use them.  The phone looks good, has a brilliant display, a very good battery time and is flawless in the apps.  The support was also superb.  We had a problem with the memory, write an e-mail to the support area of BLU and receive in one day a complete technical answer that solves the issue.  I recommend this phone!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Blu Studio 5.0, unlocked
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice phne, nice screen, works well :)  except, The internal memory is always full? I bought a larger SD card the problem still exist.For some reason I can't receive pic messages...But I can send them.The camera pics are not so great...it may be the settings????? I have been trying to contact the Blu company for technical support, thus far the waiting is so long. after 45min I hang up...Thus far I have not gotten any emails back and it has been 24hrs...service@bluproducts.com, maybe someone can give me some advice on clearing up some memory and how to receive pic messages..Consumer Cellular doesn't troubleshoot Blu settings. I have always owned samsung phnes and the pics were very Clear...This phe has 2 many factory installed Apps. missing my Samsung Galaxy Reverb  :(as of 2day 14:10, contacted co. and Problem solved...it was my APN settings....

Reviews.Title: great gift.
Reviews.Author: edward harrison
Reviews.Content: got it as a back for a friend and she loves it. it is a great deal and it is made in the usa.

Reviews.Title: this phone sucks!
Reviews.Author: Carmen Lopez
Reviews.Content: The storage space sucks! The keypad works when it wants to and randomly kicks me off websites and reboots on its own.

It works as a phone but wont got onto the internet through my data plan. Most likely will be returning the smart phone. Ill call Blu support first thing in the morning then decide....

Reviews.Author: thatchicwithagalaxy
Reviews.Content: The 4g memory is way too small. I've only had the phone a week & haven't downloaded half of the apps I had on my last phone yet I'm getting the message "storage space running low!" When I look in the settings it appears there's still space in the phone storage & on the SD card, so I'm confused. I've emailed Blu & they're responding thankfully. I'm not sure they'll help as they claim it is the phones internal memory that's running low, to move some apps over to the SD card, but some apps can not go over to the SD card. I'm afraid to root the phone & void warrenty bc then I'll get no help at all. I'll probably end up returning it. Really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: internal storage sucks

Reviews.Content: at first this phone looks great but it really is not the internal storage just sucks and now i only had it for a little while and it is not letting me get on any apps it says low memory DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE

Reviews.Title: Very Good Phone
Reviews.Author: Nephrateria Collins
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome phone, for a great price.  I have not put it down since I got it.  I received it within a week from ordering it. I have not had any problems with it. You get exactly what you pay for and more.  It doesnt have a very good front facing camera, but all of the other awesome feature will make up for it.  It is unlocked, and can be used with most service providers.  I have awesome service, and It has lightning speed.  If the cameras were better it would be, in my opinion better than most of the iphones.

Reviews.Title: Amazing phone!!! I recommend it!!!
Reviews.Author: Sergio G.
Reviews.Content: I think this phone is the nicest phone I have ever bought in my life. I wasn't sure of the quality since the brand is kind of an unknown brand, but this phone rocks. It's internationally unlocked. I ordered it Tuesday and it came today as scheduled. It's 5 inches so it's nice and wide. It's a fast phone and the apps from the PlayStore are all up to date. This phone, for the price, beats the hell out  any of the Samsung Galaxies or any other Android operated phones. I would seriously recommend it to anyone who wants to purchase this phone. Don't waste your money on other phones! This is where is at man!! Blu, has definitely impressed me with the product quality. And it comes with warranty. HOW AWESOME! I order the black version, so it's all shiny and pretty. Haha. I am currently using Straight Talk (BYOP), and it rocks. I live in Germany so I will go back in March and I really can't wait to use it over there. So, yeah, I think this phone deserves a 10 star rating. Good job, Blu! Keep it up and you will put all those big companies out of business!

Reviews.Title: i wish i didnt bought it!

Reviews.Title: carloseromeroq@gmail.com

Reviews.Content: hi am from Venezuela sending me wine coming to this date a telephone team brought me a defect the power button will not work now can not do anything these damaged that hassle!

Reviews.Title: Great investment!

Reviews.Content: This was a smart investment because now i have a smart phone for a monthly price i can handle now that makes it great!

Reviews.Title: My first smartphone -- Love it!
Reviews.Author: Sakura
Reviews.Content: I use blackberry for work and I have spent quite some time comparing different products at stores (including iPhone and all other smartphones available in market) and studying customer reviews to choose my first personal smartphone. Very happy with my decision. For me SIM-free works great since I can get a cheaper plan with flexibility and also I can take this with me abroad. Larger screen is nice. Touch screen is great too, I just cannot believe BLU made this phone at this price. Their customer service is reliable too, I had some questions about which external battery to buy and they got back to me within 24 hours. I feel lucky I found the BLU phone!The only con is a limited internal storage as others have already mentioned. I needed to install a language app for me to be able to write in my mother language, and Gmail app, and I only have 100 MB left.For those who are looking for cases, searching for "trekgear blu studio 5.0" on Amazon will get you many colorful and well designed cases. I had to do some digging to find them -- and wanted to share with you all. Their hard case is a little heavier than the black rubber case that comes with the phone, but it will add some personality to your phone.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: joseph
Reviews.Content: I find that this is a good phone, it has lived up to expectations. The only drawback is the battery life and a constant need to charge the battery.

Reviews.Title: BLU Studio 5.0 D530 Unlocked
Reviews.Author: fred mainda
Reviews.Content: I like it very much. As a student it is big enough and fast with the Apps I am able to keep up with my lectures and searches. Also able to take pictures of class lecture notes on the whiteboard. I have already given recommendations to several people and my son got one last week. I am planning to buy one for my daughter soon.

Reviews.Title: Great phone but...
Reviews.Author: TrickyLinks
Reviews.Content: I really like the phone. Delivery was on time and the price was superstupendous!  It was as described aesthetically but the memory was not what I was expecting. I downloaded 9 apps and got a message that the phone memory was running low although it showed that there were 2.09 gigs available it still wouldnt download additional apps.  I will have to manage my apps constantly or figure out a way around it. Otherwise the phone was exactly what I was expecting.  The large screen is amazing and the sound of the speakers is amazingly loud.  I love it.  I can handle the memory issue and over all I am satisfied with my purchase.

I read good reviews and thought that it would be a good device which it seemed like it was but sadly I was mistaken. I would love to give five stars if my problem were corrected but I ended up having to fix it directly with amazon.

It works well enough but the headphone jack stopped working less than a month after I got it, and to replace it I would have to send it to the company, which would take up to 2 weeks, which is why I got the phone in the first place, to avoid not having a phone any longer. I have had it since late November, and I don't think it will last much longer. The port to plug in a wall charger doesn't fit the charger well anymore, so I have to place it just in the perfect place or else it doesn't work. Being $150 when I bough it though, I shouldn't have expected much more out of it. still, definitely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: great product

Reviews.Title: Smartphone
Reviews.Author: Marie Bell 32
Reviews.Content: Great buy for teenagers!  Good quality material!  Great battery life.  Dropped original one with no screen protector on.  Replacement one was better than the first!! Kids loved the color.

Reviews.Title: Cell
Reviews.Author: Tyrone Francis
Reviews.Content: Besides the storage issue it tends to have if you are not careful when you download APPS it is a great phone that does all you need it to do in today's fast pace world.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised!
Reviews.Author: Madeleine Lietz
Reviews.Content: I recently lost my Samsung galaxy s3 and didn't want to spend the money replacing it. Used galaxy s3's were $300 and brand new ones are $600+. I needed a cheaper alternative that would hold me until my upgrade this Nov. and I didn't buy an insurance plan on my phone.My husband researched this phone for me on Walmart.com. We were unsure, but willing to take a gamble because of the amazing price- $130.I have ATT, this phone is up and running for me and I have don't mind it all. The screen is bigger than my samsung galaxy s3 also!The graphics aren't as good and the camera quality isn't as good as my samsung phone. But it's well worth $130. It works great! Not much storage space either so you must buy an outside SD card! Only 3G too - so a bit slower than my 4G service.Also, the phone came with a rubber case, a charger, a screen protector and earphones! The charger was European, but thankfully my husband had converters. Even then, the phone fits into my samsung charger, so that wasn't a hassle for me.Great phone! Works great! Amazing price!

Reviews.Title: Unlocked phone
Reviews.Author: shebbie
Reviews.Content: This phone was amazing. Fast, huge 5" screen. Very easy to use. Loved it. Then noticed that couldn't open a picture in the messaging. First week was really fast to charge battery.Then it started taking longer.  Called the company to get additional batteries & was told that there aren't any. ALso had problems swiping & unlocking phone. Next, it kept telling me I was out of storage space & wouldn't let me play games or get email until I cleared space.  This phone has capacity for dual sim cards & had  a 16 g SD card in it. Should have had lots of storage space.  Long story short, not being able to get another battery was the deciding factor for not keeping this phone. Read lots of comments before ordering. Some purchasers were extremely satisified with no issues.  I wasn't one of the fortunate ones.  But called Amazon & they refunded my money immedieately. If additional batteries were an option, I would order another one of these phones.

Reviews.Content: If you look at what u pay for phones in the store u pay about 400+ this phone pretty much has the same features, quailtys when people see my phone they ask where did I get it an what is it. Little do they no I only paid 130$. I have two bad things about the phone they give u a forieng looking USB charger so I had to hook up my USB they gave me to another charger base to go into the wall the charger they gave me can't go in my wall lol. Also they told me I would get a micro SD card I didn't get one in the box so now I have to go an buy my own but I gave four stars due to I saved money only paying 130$. On the bright side the screen is really big an the words an apps are a little big which isn't a problem. The ringer was loud I see some people were saying they can barely here there phone. Ive had the phone for 2days now I will keep everyone posed.

Reviews.Title: Happy with phone after (3) weeks of use
Reviews.Author: mikegemco "susieqmuench"
Reviews.Content: Phone works great!  Very happy after (3) weeks.Had a feature phone for (3) years before this phone.  Had an S4 for three weeks before receiving this phone.  S4 had too many options (ATT and Samsung software, some doing the same feature; keyboards, photo editing etc..).  The S4 had (2) gb of ram but 1.5 were apps added or running in background by ATT google + whomever.  This phone has .5 gb and .12 gb running in in background and was not slow in changing screens.  AND I have not had any apps added (run) without my consent!The Phone itself; Physically bigger than the S4 BUT the viewing screen is the same size.  This phone has older software android 4.1, and features only 3G services.  coming from a feature phone this is an improvement, your situation my vari.Comes with screen protector, case, and wall charger.I do suggest to people to purchase this phone,  I have no question android users would love this phone.  Iphone users would have a learning curve, although a $120 learning curve as opposed to a $600 Iphone (x) without learning curve.

Seriously its a smart phone it should be able to have more then 5 apps before it starts saying storage space full! This is such a downer because I like the phone but dont think Ill be able to keep it because of this issue

Reviews.Content: I am in love with this phone I use it on Tmobile prepaid and it's great I watch Netfix mostly and check my emails I don't play games a lot...

Reviews.Content: I put my tmobile sims card in and it was on!  No problems at all.  I love this phone.  It's just the right size, I get my emails, youtube, facebook, everything with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Die Hard Samsung User... Won over!
Reviews.Author: Mcardona722
Reviews.Content: Ok, Fist of all I will say that I have been a die hard Samsung user since the Galaxy S3 came out. Ive had the S3, the S4 and the Note 1 and 2 since.  The last phone I bought before this one was a Nokia, and well, I hated it.  Someone told me about these phones because I was looking to upgrade but didnt exactly have money to drop $600 on an unlocked phone since I wasnt eligible for upgrade yet.  My first reaction was " WHO is BLU?"  My husband makes fun of me, because anytime any one in my family including myself gets a phone, I do research! I look at what the experts think of a phone, and then look on here for reviews from customers, only this time I looked into this company as a whole, Who are they? What is their goal?  After looking at both I decided " I might give this a try, worse case senario I can just return" well, I ordered and got it the very next day!I was a skeptic through a through, I got this phone two days ago and have been waiting on something I dont like to appear.  (Keep in mind I am use to the Samsung standard when it comes to phones, thats a pretty high bar to try and reach for!) i pushed this phone, I had multiple things downloading, I was surfing the web.. I was making calls and texting people and NOTHING bad was happening, this phone performed like a PRO!  I have waited for software glitches, or something to happen but its been great! The only issue Ive even found is you can not make folders on your home screen so all the apps are either in your menu or on your home screen, which is really not an issue for me! The screen size is comparable to a note, just a tad bit smaller as I compared the two on top of each other. The phone COMES WITH a screen protector and a gel case that completes the phone!  My husband was also a skeptic, and he loves my phone so much, we will be buying him AND my daughter this phone!  Great screen, great camera, and even though this phone is 3G , and our carrier is a 4G provider, you cant tell it only handles 3G.  Most of the time I get a "H" where my signal is and that basically means a little faster than 3G.. Anyway, yes this company is new, but everyone has to start somewhere!  Give Blu a try, I doubt you will be dispeased.  Solid build phone, great features! Only one way I can say they should improve, and that is what everyone complains about their phone.. The battery life.  It lasts a day, and I am a heavy phone user, that just means I have to charge every night, so not an issue for me, but I know some ppl want their phones to last days, and thats just not realistic with every phone!

Don't base your reviews on a bad experience, phones go bad all the time it's the nature of the business.I really recommend it, Great Phone!Affordable, Fast, Full Android Features

Once she transferred all her Google contact information the phone began to show it's true colors.  Because she has a tremendous amount contacts the 4GB 512MB of RAM was just overwhelmed and the phone began to shudder, freeze and just plain unresponsive. So 2 days later we returned the phone and sprung for a used Galaxy S2 from eBay.

Reviews.Title: my quick review
Reviews.Author: Amgstaff
Reviews.Content: I had bought the Blu life play for wife and well she loves that thing! that' is a nice phone!!! bit more expensive than this one but battery life is longer and you get hd screen with the life play.Now, all i can say is I'm very happy with the phone perfect size! Works smooth and it's a new android ''Kernel Version'' OS.. Android version 4.1.2..Now, to be honest this phone does exactly what i was doing with when i had a samsung note 1 phone without the extra features so to speak the note had vs the Blu 5.0 doesn't have. Take in mind it's not as quick as the samsung note ... there is a reason why the phone is way cheaper... but... at the same time... this is a great phone!!! way worth the buck!Wifi works great... currently using it until i connect with provider and no issue connecting wifi at all! yes!Hotspot worked as well!!! yes!had no issues with the phone...CONN!! CONN!!OH HOW I HATE THIS CONN!!READY!!THE battery!!! man it agrivates me to see how quick the battery dies before my eyes...i just don't understand why they couldn't put a better battery in there with better life... but i will suck it up and charge the phone maybe 1x to max 2 x a day yes!  i know.. but it's true...Example:1:14pm- 95%2:01pm- 80% --- why!! why blu ahaah why!3:53pm- 51%---Listened to music for another hour maybe on way home and plugged up when i got home hour later or so around 5pm... so hope this helps....Pros!everything else!

Reviews.Title: So So
Reviews.Author: E. Chamoun
Reviews.Content: "I have received my phone Blu, but I just realized that all products Blu are having problems with the audio. Previously I had purchased the Dash 3.5 and the inside speaker stopped working. The current model (Studio 5.0) also faces problems with the handset (only hear left speaker). Indeed I think that even if the product is not completely bad, you should check them so that the consumer receives a quality product. The price I paid for the latter is $ 150 (a price is not very cheap because we are talking about more than RD $ 6,000.00) plus tax which is higher than 30%.Yo he recibido mi celular Blu, pero me acabo de dar cuenta que todos los productos Blu están confrontando problemas con el audio. Anteriormente yo había adquirido el Dash 3.5 y la bocina dejó de funcionar. El actual modelo (Studio 5.0) confronta también problemas con el auricular (solo se escucha una sola bocina). Verdaderamente yo pienso que aunque el producto no sea completamente malo, se debería de chequear los mismos fin de que el consumidor reciba un producto de calidad. El precio que yo he pagado por este ultimo es 150 dólares (un precio que no es muy barato pues estamos hablando de más de RD$6,000.00) más los impuestos que es mayor de un 30%. "

Reviews.Title: Works alright
Reviews.Author: Kina
Reviews.Content: When I first got the phone I was thrilled. The screen is huge and there are a lot of great features for the phone's price. However, I did run into a few problems. First, I use the StraightTalk network and while switching over my number was not a problem, I found that I was unable to get the 3G running. Only after having the phone for over a month did I figure out the problem on my own. Neither Blu nor StraightTalk were helpful. Also, the phone is always low on memory, and tends to run slow sometimes. This is why I would highly suggest having an SD card to put your apps on. Another problem I have is that only the headphones that come with the phone work properly with the phone. The ones they come with are really crappy and even now those ones are falling apart. However, besides those problems I find that you get pretty much what you pay for. The phone is in no way terrible and it is definitely a major up grade from my previous phone.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: Leante'
Reviews.Content: The Blu Life Play is s***!!!!! Two of my friends and I bought this phone at the same time and we all experience the same problem. I have not had my Blu for 6 months yet and I am already want to slam it against the wall. My friends and I all had problems with our charge port, the case started to crack and it also started to freeze and NOOOO!!!! i do not have a bunch of apps or a virus. If your planning to buy this affordable smart phone then i beg you  DO NOT!!!! save the money and buy a reliable popular brand like sony or apple r even a nokia but not this S***!!! .

Reviews.Title: Terrible phone

Reviews.Content: Has small storage space. The sound is terrible, I cannot hear what the other person is saying nor can they hear what I'm saying! You just hear a caller talking at a distance and you have to keep repeating them. But the screen is great!

Reviews.Title: Fragile touchscreen, TERRIBLE customer service
Reviews.Author: DOUGLAS DUBE
Reviews.Content: The product features are good - my son loved it when it arrived.  But within 3 weeks the touchscreen broke. He had it in his pocket and got bumped. Given that he carried his prior cell the same way for 20 months without incident, this made us believe the touchscreen is fragile. Much, much worse is the customer service for this product. I sent them an email asking whether the screen was covered by a warranty, and if not where and how could we get it fixed and at what cost. The response was "We don't have any touchscreens for this cell at this time, check back in two weeks." So they didn't say whether a warranty might cover it, they didn't say how much to fix it if not under warranty, and they put the burden on me to check back with them, rather than saying they'd let me know when touchscreens come in. Based on the fragility and the terrible customer service, I would not recommend this product to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Just THE smart phone I've been looking for ....
Reviews.Author: N. Cheung "food for thought"
Reviews.Content: First off, this is an unlocked GSM phone. I am able to just insert my Go-phone SIM card (for AT&T;) and it works right away. There is a second SIM slot for an out of area alternate card. It is an Android device that comes with Google's Play already there, so I am able to load my previously purchased Play programs onto it. The device though has only 2 Gig flash mem, although the ad. has said 4 Gig. Thankfully there is a micro-SD slot which can accept up to 32 Gig. The screen is bright, clear, and with such great resolution and color rendition that I wouldn't mind using it to surf the web or for reading my eBooks. The signal reception has been great and does not heat up under the clothing like my friend's iPhone. I am using it as a backup to my PC when I don't have the portal (ie, no wi-fi access) to reach the Internet. I have not used the camera feature yet and therefore the large-ish Li battery is lasting many days. Just the only thing I wish to see improvement on is how the back-cover can be taken off easier and more conveniently. For now, a flat blade screw driver is a must in order to pry the cover off to insert the SIM and micro-SD cards, and to replace the battery. BTW the Android version on this phone is 4.1.2 and my understanding is that it is the 4.1.1 version that may have the "heart-bleed bug". So hopefully this phone I have has the safer version of the SSL.

Reviews.Title: Really Enjoyed the Phone until the glitch.
Reviews.Author: Dondra
Reviews.Content: I am having some issues with this phone.  It hasn't been wet on the inside of the phone but jst a lil bit on the screen protector but it's jumping and navigating to pages that I didn't try to navigate to .  I really enjoyed it before this happend .  Great Cellphone , wish it was also CDMA compatible though.

Reviews.Content: Excellent ... I like a lot, I will buy another to do a gift, I recommended to buy it ¡Great! so I can't use it because I must include the serial at my Company Local Cell-Phone

Reviews.Title: Not happy with this phone!
Reviews.Author: Linda C Keels
Reviews.Content: I saw this phone and fell in love with it, so I ordered it. It has been a night mare. Bad reception, speakers are terrible, NO space to download anything. I have downloaded only one thing and there is no room for anything else. I wanted to download more bible material, but after I downloaded the bible, oh well that was all my room. Can not send pic but can receive them. On a scale of 1-10 this phone gets a 1. Can't afford to change it now, but as soon as I can its out of my life!!! Can anyone help me please. Would love to send it back, but I think I had it to long now.

Reviews.Title: This piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Ive had this phone for almost a year now and i thought it was just awesome. My brother and i have had a series of unfortunate events with this very product.the only reason i gave this two stars is because the idea  of the phone was just great.  Low cost with all the features of a galaxy note give or take a few. I thought it was an awesome phone and i bought it. The camera in good lighting conditions was awesome. The front camera was always terrible but that was no big deal for me. Here is where the problem lies. The phone was durable and seemed almost as if nothing would go wrong. This month ive had the most problems ive experienced from a phone and i think the oldest blackberry wouldn't give me this problem. The phone would literally press parts of the screen on its own and when ever i changed the volume lines would go across the screen not to mention that while listening to stay by Rihanna the speakers blew. The last problem occurred today and the screen turned completely white and now the phone is useless unless i replace the screen . Among other small problems were short term battery life, speakers too low etc. its a good phone if you dont plan to keep it for more than 3 months otherwise i think you would be better off buying a more expensive and durable phone for what its worth.

Reviews.Author: Auntlucy
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I actually live on 2 different continents and this phone has 2 SIM card slots.It may not be an IPhone but for the price who cares.I have loved it.I had it out of my purse while in a local grocery store in Italy and I attracted a crowd.It seems that younger men are particularily interested in my new purchase.What a great toy and phone too.It has gone beyond my expectations!!

Reviews.Author: lisar915
Reviews.Content: It's bigger than my original Samsung Galaxy SIII.  I also like the case that came with it.  The internet isn't always on.  You have to go to your settings to make sure "Data Connection" is on.  Also it doesn't have 4G.  But it works fine for me.

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone, but ONLY 500MB available on phone for Applications (Definitely NOT 4GB)
Reviews.Author: Lazer "Lazer"
Reviews.Content: What were they thinking??Nice Phone, but ONLY 500MB available on phone for Applications (NOT 4GB).The internal drive is factory partitioned to only allow 500MB for apps! (Other BLU phones in this price range that I have encountered usually have at least 1GB available).This is a paltry amount of available memory for an android phone. I only realized it on the phone when I ran out of space to install apps the first day I had it, and then called BLU support, who verified it, because it was hard to believe. Not half as much as other similar BLU phones I have encountered. Amazing because it has very few Bloatware factory unremovable apps on board.Apparently BLU engineering designated other RAM memory just for photos and the like.  Why would the do this?  Couldn't get my all my needs apps to fit!!!Other BLU phone in this price range have at least 1.0GB available - and that is also paltry, but manageable for many people for whom I set these phones up.There are  definitely other Blu phones with more memory available and on paper the specs look the same, but again:The ONLY to find out before you buy it seems to be to call BLU Support first. They admit that these are unpublished specs. (As of May 2014)

This is HUGE in comparison.The positives...Seems to run the few apps I have quicklyMy daughter loves the camera features. Even the front facing camera has cool features4Gig SD card from my old phone works just fine in this oneI received it sooner than I expected!It comes with a jelly case and screen protectorThe negatives...Speaker phone isn't very loudDoesn't come with Swype keyboard feature but I was able to download one from the PlayStore.Like everyone else has mentioned, the internal memory isn't much so make sure you move apps to your SD card

Reviews.Author: Chad Takakura
Reviews.Content: Got the phone for my daughter. Wasn't what we thought it was. First of all, the camera is of poor quality. It's blurry and there is a lag when videoing. When she tries to go on snapchat, the camera starts to glitch. We don't know if the video camera is faulty or that it can't handle the app but whatever the case, she is not a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: stopped charging after a month! HORRIBLE customer service
Reviews.Author: Jessi
Reviews.Content: I spent $300 on this phone in Turkey (cell phones are very pricey there), because I read these great reviews. After a mere month, it stopped charging. One night it was charging and the next... I wake up and it's not.Also, the customer service is a pathetic waste of time. You have to answer a bunch of questions and wait forever for them to get back to you. They advised me to contact their sister company (since it's the sister company that sells overseas), and I had stated the reason why I was contacting them was I wasn't getting a response from their sister company. Each time we emailed, they had the same response: "You need to contact General Mobile."General Mobile's support webpage doesn't work. When you submit a complaint or problem, you get an error message.Coincidence? Highly doubtful. Don't waste your time with this stupid company. Now I have a $300 phone that has only worked for 1 month. I loved the phone, but, umm... I can't use it if it won't charge.

My first, the 5s was the right size and had a great op system but had issues with staying connected with cell towers and weak signal.This phone is the complete opposite. (We live in a rural area with terrible coverage) The dual core processor works all my also well. Overall the phone works well and would have received 5stars but I have had Bluetooth connection issues when the phone tries to switch between my devices.For reference this phone is a about the same size as the Galaxy Note II

I use the  outdoor setting for the ring due to hearing loss and can hear it with no problems. This phone is  fantastic for the price you pay for it. I would recommend a back up battery if you are on it for long periods though and an SD card.  :)

Reviews.Content: I am currently living in the Dominican Republic and bought this phone for use with a carrier here. It was a process gettin ghere because it would not send internationally so I needed to spend an extra 100 dollars for UPS to send it. When it arrived, all seemed well, but after one day, the power button stopped working. I now have to go get that fixed Everything else is fine, but that really should not be happening.

Reviews.Title: great screen, super fast on wifi, lots of apps -- sound not so good
Reviews.Author: Patrick-André
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I didn't want to dish out $600 for a Samsung Galaxy. This phone has a big screen (which I love), it's super fast on Wifi, no problem with calls, text messages, etc. The battery life is good, you can use Netflix, lots of news apps, youtube, almost like a tablet. The only drawback is that it is designed for 3G, so although I have an unlimited plan with T-Mobile on 4G, I only get 3G speeds. I wish I had waited a few months, since I now see BLU models with 4G capability for the same price. BLU is a great, affordable alternative for people who want a Samsung but don't want to be sucked into a 2-year commitment.

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY
Reviews.Author: Brady
Reviews.Content: I have had every cell phone company available with contracts and I finally got feed up with all their fees and taxes and all the extra stuff they like to charge you. I decided within my region to try simple mobile cell phone company and have had a regular andriod phone and a I phone 5 on this service. The amount of money you save is crazy. The only down fall is because Im on the $40.00 plan i get unlimted data but after so many GB its slows down dramactically but who CARES because i have internet at work and at home I can just connect to WIFI and thats not including most public places offer WIFI which kinda increase the speed a little. I bough this phone because i was tired of my I phone and wanted something else it has turned out to be great! Its a bigger then im use to but I can manage. The camera is just OK I have had better but no big deal for me considering I carry my actual camera everywhere with me. I got the package within 5 days and I thought it just came with phone and charger but it also included a jelly case and ear buds and screen protector great vaul for 115.00 and free shipping !  It gets the job done and its way less money that you would pay with sprint/ tmobile/verizon ETC.  You can also buy insurance for 55.00 from walamrt and if you have to file a claim its 29.00 and they will fix/replace your phone, which is also cheaper then the insurance you pay for with other conpanies.  IM WINNING !!! GO AND BUY!

Reviews.Title: Worked Well
Reviews.Author: L. Tong
Reviews.Content: I bought this unlocked phone for my trip to Hong Kong.  I bought a OneSimCard SIM to use with it and tested the dual SIM capability with this phone as well.  The dual SIM feature is simple and easy to navigate through.Wi-fi and browser capability is pretty awesome and saved me a few times sanity-wise.  I downloaded a few apps -- the phone really doesn't have enough space to download lots of apps. WhatsApp, Facebook, Netflix, and Skype work great.  I also downloaded apps that work with OneSIMCard.  I had to disable some other apps just to run the installer when the phone ran out of room, but enabled them again afterwards.  Wish there was more space allocated to apps.It's nice to be able to be in airplane mode and activate wi-fi now that some airlines offer wi-fi.I did have to reboot the phone a couple of times to connect to the wi-fi properly, but it reboots pretty quick.The manual really isn't comprehensive.  I learned some things just by being bored and playing around with the phone. I know I can take a snapshot of my screen because I did this accidentally but have not been able to do this since.  Found some folks who said to hold the volume up and power button, and others who say to hold the volume low and power button, but neither worked.  If anyone knows, please let me know!

Reviews.Title: You don't get what you pay for- you get something a little better
Reviews.Author: Christina Hayes "christinahayes"
Reviews.Content: This gets 4 stars because, well, it's a smart phone for under $100, so any problems I've had with it, I'm willing to put up with.It worked fine out of the box and I haven't had any problems with the speed of the apps I run.  Call quality is fine, speaker isn't amazing but it's fine.  The camera, too, isn't impressive but it's about as good as most other smart phone cameras.I'd say the major weakness of the phone is its extremely small internal memory.  I did install a 32GB mini-SD card, It took a little playing around to figure out how to move my apps to the SD card, to free up the memory on the phone.  Even having done that, I'm to the point now that any time I try to download a new app, or my email, it says there's insufficient memory available.  The phone gives me a message that I need to "unpin some tasks from the taskbar" but doesn't tell me how to do that.  There's nothing that looks like a taskbar, or pinning, on this phone.  I'm sure I'll figure it out at some point, but I would rather the phone just work like everyone else's.  Note that I am not a huge app user; I've filled up less than 1 GB so far on my SD card.The battery life is fine.  I'm not a heavy user, so during a day I'm probably on the phone for 10 min, send less than a dozen texts, and spend maybe an hour or two on the internet and using apps.  I always have some battery at the end of the day but sometimes it's down to 20-30%. If you are a really heavy user you would probably have to charge it during the day.  It takes 3-4 hours to fully charge.Overall  I'm happy with my purchase- this is my first smart phone, and I didn't want to be in a contract and I can't imagine having to worry about dropping a $300+ phone.  You're not getting an iphone for this price but it's not a bad phone.

I kept having to remind myself that I bought it for $150 unlocked, which is awesome.Battery: Works great for me, makes it all day with moderate use.Volume: Worst part about this phone, it is quiet in the headset, speakerphone and earpiece. Maybe they will release an update to fix this?Screen: A solid...meh. It is clear and bright but the viewing angle and resolution are terrible, or great if you consider that this is a $150 phone. I love the 5" size, I think this is perfect for a cell phone.Phone is lag free, works fine and does 99% of what I want acceptably. Best of all I am off the money pit and contract of Verizon.

Reviews.Title: Battery drains fast, but takes long to charge
Reviews.Author: AndrewT
Reviews.Content: Been playing with this phone for a few days.  In general, it is a decent phone.  My 2 immediate complaints:1) battery drains fast.  I played around, get to know my phone, after an hour or so the phone is in the red (20% left).  I plugged it in, and the phone estimated the charge with be 3 hrs.  It did take about that long.  Not so impressed.2) built in ring tones are very limited, most are unpleasant.It is very decent for the price still.  I would recommend it for the economic reason.

Reviews.Title: I like it so far...
Reviews.Author: Russ in PA
Reviews.Content: I'll start off by saying I am not a cell phone power user; in fact I bought my first one in Germany last October, an older model Samsung GT-S5230. I bought it to help resolve some travel issues and have only used it sparingly since. The little Samsung is unlocked and certainly suitable for my use in Germany and here in the US.I decided, however, to look into a smart phone for my upcoming vacation in Germany this October. I settled on the Blu Studio 5.0 since it was unlocked, offered dual SIM capability, a decently-large screen, 3G and Wi-Fi, and, above all, a modest price. I wasn't convinced that a smart phone really offered me sufficient reason to spend more money for a top-line phone.So, I've used the phone for two weeks now, including 7 days in Germany and am pleased with the phone. Phone conversations were no problem from either end that I could tell and I didn't have the audio adjusted higher than about half way. I didn't use the earpiece or radio, so can't comment there. To this point I haven't noticed a problem with the charging connection that others have complained about, and I typically charged the phone almost every night. It usually didn't need charged, but I did so to see if the connector would turn out to be a problem; so far not.My biggest complaints on the phone would be that the manual is quite poor, so I found it easier to search Youtube for suggestions in using an Android OS. And the screen is hard to see outside, although such is the case with just about every other phone I've seen or tried. I don't have the best eyesight and I am color-blind...  And as others have suggested, it would be great to have a decent silicone cover like the one that I purchased for the Samsung on Amazon. I found the cover supplied with the phone to be poor as I couldn't activate the on-off button with any consistency when the cover was mounted.Will the phone hold up? Will it receive Android updates? I don't know, but so far I'm quite pleased with the phone. But I still have the Samsung just in case...

Reviews.Author: rtk
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Nice Big Screen. Easily see things on the screen.  Good Feel and light.Cons:  Couldn't handle the small amount of Apps that I loaded on it.  I even added a 32GB SD card and moved some of the apps to it.  And kept getting out of memory errors.  Had a hard time finding a case and belt clip case for it.I ended up returning it for a different phone.

Reviews.Title: Minor software issue makes phone almost useless
Reviews.Author: J. Alsterlind
Reviews.Content: The screen dims after about 10 seconds making the phone very frustrating to use.  I tried calling and emailing tech support but they weren't able to fix.  I tried install screen lighting apps and searching the web for solutions but got nowhere.  My regular phone is a S4 gpse and I didn't mind the lower resolution screen or slower processor but the dimming screen was a deal breaker.  Too bad they are not able to support this phone better.

Reviews.Title: AWFUL!
Reviews.Author: Cate
Reviews.Content: I don't want to sound extremely terrible, but this phone is just awful. When I tried setting up the phone, it took nearly 2 hours to even get it to read the SIM card. Then, the headphones were broke--the sound only came in clear if you held the button down on the headphones. Internet connection and messaging were here and there (but mostly "there"), and the sound wasn't very clear when you used the phone on speaker. Another thing with the messaging is that it was pretty slow and the "space" key didn't want to work. I'd write out a whole sentence to find it read "Idk why that wouldnamdvthat because there professions" when I intended on typing "Idk why they would do that because they're professionals." Also, the size was a problem for me. A lot of people can handle big phones, but this felt like I was holding a tablet to my head when I was on the phone. In the end, I returned the phone and now I'm just waiting for my refund.

Reviews.Title: Great so far!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Only had it for less than a week but it works great. Very nice to look at and big enough for reading things without squinting. I was somewhat concerned because I had only had Droid X phone but it was dying so I needed to change. Somewhat concerned about getting a signal in our house as once before we had the same carrier and had to leave because we couldn't use our phones at home. This phone gets a strong signal anywhere in our house. Really like the "bird song" it has for notifications. It has a place for two sim cards but works very well with only one. Would recommend highly based on the time I've had it.

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: This phone definitely works better than the LG phones I purchased through Net 10.  The battery life isn't great.  I have to charge it everyday though I only check my email daily.  If I use my Bluetooth, the battery drains more quickly (I'm not sure if synching with the car attributed to this).  I also cannot download pics that are sent via text message which is a compatibility issue between the phone and Net 10. People can see pics that I send to them.  I had to download adobe acrobat to read PDFs via this phone.  I have not figured out which app I need to download in order to read "docs".  I am also not sure what effect not having a dual sim card has. However, I believe this phone is great for basic usage

Reviews.Title: Used for New and Poor quality
Reviews.Author: P. leung "pkl"
Reviews.Content: The one star is for the combination of my ordering and product appearance experiences.1  First, I ordered a new one and they sent me an used one.  After my complaint to Amazon on the phone, I was asked to return the product and they asked me to order another one.  As a result, I paid 127.49 in my second purchase instead of 199.99 origianally paid.  I got a one day shipping free.2. The second one was new.  It works good but the phone has a defect that the metal (could be plastic) frame around the screen has a chip that cannot be repaired.3. The phone was not preloaded with WhatsApp & Youtube as promised in advertisement.I am still not able to have time to test all function of the phone.  However, phone call, email, and messaging functions seem to work OK.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy It! EVER!
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: I am not a cell phone expert so I didn't really know what to expect. Product details say 4 gigs, when I got it it only says 2 gigs. To make matters worse it doesn't even use it, instead it only uses the 512 megs of ram it has. Right away I got "Out of memory" errors and the phone automatically uninstalls apps. So I got a 16 gig micro SD card, didn't help a bit. Moved as many apps as I could to the SD card, but many Google apps don't give you that option.Really pissed about being lied to about the memory.The camera on this is beyond terrible. Think a cheap digital camera from the 1990's quality.So in conclusion unless you only plan on send some txts or making calls it should fine. Consider it an overpriced flip phone, because it is worthless for running apps.

Basically a "just buy a different phone" answer.Viewing angles are poor as well. looking at it like you would any other phone means the bottom half of the screen is blacked out. Tilt the top away from you and it's better.The screen size is big, but it's a polished turd at best.Waiting for the nexus 5, then this will go one of my kids, if they can handle the lack of netflix.
